actor_awards.notes: One of the most prolific actors in Hollywood history, known for his roles as Count Dracula and Casy in The Grapes of Wrath.

filmography.title: The Prisoner of Shark Island
filmography.role_description: A cruel and sadistic prison guard who torments Dr. Samuel Mudd.
filmography.plot: The story of Dr. Samuel Mudd, the physician who treated John Wilkes Booth and was imprisoned for conspiracy.

filmography.title: Mary of Scotland
filmography.role_description: The Italian secretary and confidant to Mary, Queen of Scots, whose influence leads to his murder.
filmography.plot: Mary Stuart returns to Scotland to claim her throne, facing political intrigue and romance with Bothwell.

filmography.title: Captains Courageous
filmography.role_description: A superstitious and resentful fisherman aboard the schooner We're Here.
filmography.plot: A spoiled brat who falls overboard from a steamship is rescued by a fishing boat and made to earn his keep.

filmography.title: Jesse James
filmography.role_description: The treacherous outlaw who famously shoots Jesse James in the back.
filmography.plot: After railroad agents kill their mother, Jesse and Frank James turn to banditry to exact revenge on the company.

filmography.title: Stagecoach
filmography.role_description: A mysterious Southern gambler who joins the stagecoach journey to protect a fellow passenger.
filmography.plot: A group of people traveling on a stagecoach find their journey complicated by the threat of Geronimo and learn something about each other in the process.

filmography.title: The Hound of the Baskervilles
filmography.role_description: The loyal, secretive butler of Baskerville Hall in the first Holmes film starring Basil Rathbone.
filmography.plot: Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson investigate the legend of a supernatural hound plaguing a noble family on the moors.

filmography.title: Drums Along the Mohawk
filmography.role_description: A British Tory spy who leads attacks against the American settlers.
filmography.plot: Newlyweds try to establish a farm in the Mohawk Valley but face the menace of Indians and Tories as the Revolutionary War begins.

filmography.title: The Grapes of Wrath
filmography.role_description: A former preacher who loses his faith but finds a new cause fighting for the rights of migrant workers.
filmography.plot: A poor Midwest family is forced off their land during the Great Depression and travels to California, suffering the misfortunes of the homeless.

filmography.title: Blood and Sand
filmography.role_description: A bullfighter and member of the cuadrilla who meets a tragic end in the ring.
filmography.plot: An illiterate peasant rises to fame as a matador, but his passion for a beautiful aristocrat threatens his marriage and career.

filmography.title: Man Hunt
filmography.role_description: A sinister British agent working for the Nazis who pursues the protagonist through London.
filmography.plot: A British hunter vacationing in Bavaria gets Hitler in his gun sight, is caught, beaten, and left for dead, but escapes back to London.

filmography.title: Hitler's Madman
filmography.role_description: The ruthless Nazi official whose assassination leads to the destruction of Lidice.
filmography.plot: The story of the assassination of Nazi Reinhard Heydrich and the subsequent massacre of the village of Lidice.

filmography.title: Bluebeard
filmography.role_description: A puppeteer and painter in 19th-century Paris who murders his models.
filmography.plot: A puppeteer in Paris murders women who pose for his paintings, leading the police on a chase.

filmography.title: House of Frankenstein
filmography.role_description: The legendary vampire who is revived by a mad scientist as part of a traveling horror show.
filmography.plot: A mad scientist escapes prison and revives Dracula, the Wolf Man, and the Frankenstein Monster to exact revenge on his enemies.

filmography.title: House of Dracula
filmography.role_description: The vampire Count who seeks a cure for his condition from a scientist.
filmography.plot: Dracula and the Wolf Man seek cures for their afflictions from a scientist, who also discovers the Frankenstein Monster.

filmography.title: Fallen Angel
filmography.role_description: A phony psychic and con artist who rolls into town and sets up a séance racket.
filmography.plot: A drifter marries a small-town girl for her money, planning to divorce her and run off with a waitress, who turns up murdered.

filmography.title: Johnny Guitar
filmography.role_description: The loyal, philosophical employee of Vienna who meets a tragic end.
filmography.plot: A strong-willed saloon owner battles the local townspeople and a rival rancher who want to force her out.

filmography.title: The Egyptian
filmography.role_description: A cynical thief who guides the protagonist through the Valley of the Kings.
filmography.plot: In ancient Egypt, a poor orphan becomes a brilliant physician and travels the known world.

filmography.title: The Court Jester
filmography.role_description: The 'King of Jesters and Jester of Kings' whose identity is stolen by Danny Kaye's character.
filmography.plot: A hapless carnival performer masquerades as the court jester as part of a plot against an evil ruler who has overthrown the rightful king.

filmography.title: The Ten Commandments
filmography.role_description: The brother of Moses who becomes the first High Priest of the Israelites.
filmography.plot: Moses discovers his Hebrew heritage and leads his people out of Egypt, facing the wrath of Pharaoh Rameses.

filmography.title: Around the World in 80 Days
filmography.role_description: A blustering American colonel who challenges Phileas Fogg to a duel on a train.
filmography.plot: A Victorian Englishman bets that with the new steamships and railways he can circumnavigate the globe in eighty days.

filmography.title: The Last Hurrah
filmography.role_description: A powerful, conservative newspaper editor and bitter enemy of Mayor Frank Skeffington.
filmography.plot: An aging mayor embarks on his final campaign, facing opposition from the changing political landscape.

filmography.title: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance
filmography.role_description: A bombastic orator and politician representing the cattle barons at the statehood convention.
filmography.plot: A senator returns to a western town for the funeral of an old friend and tells the story of his origins.

filmography.title: Boxcar Bertha
filmography.role_description: A wealthy railroad tycoon who becomes the target of labor union organizers and train robbers.
filmography.plot: A union leader and a young woman turn to train robbery in the American South during the Depression.

filmography.title: The Shootist
filmography.role_description: The town undertaker who is eager to profit from the impending death of the famous gunfighter.
filmography.plot: A dying gunfighter spends his last days looking for a way to die with a minimum of pain and a maximum of dignity.

filmography.title: The Secret of NIMH
filmography.role_description: The ancient, wise, and terrifying owl who advises Mrs. Brisby to seek the rats of NIMH.
filmography.plot: To save her ill son, a field mouse must seek the aid of a colony of rats, with whom she has a deeper link than she suspected.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Win – Best Animated Film

filmography.title: Peggy Sue Got Married
filmography.role_description: A lodge member and friend who provides a philosophical perspective in this time-travel drama.
filmography.plot: Peggy Sue faints at a high school reunion and wakes up in her senior year of high school in 1960.
